                                                                                                                                                                                                                       10049234                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Description & Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint a complete picture for our clients—around the clock and around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology—quickly and accurately. We apply product thinking, deep domain expertise, and technical insight to continuously improve our data offerings, ensuring they remain reliable, scalable, and fit-for-purpose in a fast-changing landscape. Our Team:The Entities Data team is responsible for Bloomberg’s core entity and issuer reference data—a foundational component of the financial data ecosystem. Entity data uniquely identifies and defines legal and operating entities such as public and private companies, government bodies, investment vehicles, and corporate structures. It provides critical linkages between datasets and is crucial for use cases including regulatory compliance, risk modeling, investment analysis, counterparty exposure, and ownership research. This data powers a wide range of financial applications—from mapping issuers to securities and understanding corporate hierarchies, to identifying exposure to private market entities and aggregating risk at the parent or group level. Maintaining accurate, timely, and scalable entity data is crucial for client trust and operational efficiency, and as such, we are undergoing a strategic modernization of our platform to support new capabilities and emerging market needs. The Role:We are seeking a Data Product Owner to lead the strategy, development, and evolution of Bloomberg’s Entity and Issuer data products. You will be accountable for the overall value delivery of the dataset—ensuring it meets the current and emerging needs of Bloomberg clients, aligns with internal product goals, and adheres to high standards of quality, transparency, and usability. You will evaluate and prioritize improvements to the dataset based on feedback from clients, internal consumers, and subject matter experts. You will create and maintain a comprehensive delivery roadmap that balances short-term enhancements with long-term innovative goals. Working in close partnership with Engineering, Data, and Product Management teams, you’ll drive initiatives that modernize the dataset, improve delivery mechanisms, and support advanced analytical capabilities across platforms. We'll trust you to:Own the end-to-end strategy and roadmap for the Entity data, balancing technical modernization with business impact. Define the vision of what a fit-for-purpose Entity data product looks like and ensure its continuous alignment with evolving industry use cases. Lead discovery and prioritization activities to evaluate dataset needs—including structural, quality, coverage, and delivery enhancements. Translate internal and external clients feedback into actionable product requirements and define acceptance criteria for new features. Coordinate with Engineering and Core Product to deliver iterative improvements, manage technical dependencies, and ensure high performance and scalability. Define and supervise data product health metrics such as completeness, freshness, linkages, and fitness for consumption. Champion the importance of Entity data across Bloomberg, helping internal teams design and deliver better data experiences. Stay current on market trends, regulatory changes related to reference data and entity resolution. You'll need to have:4+ years working within the domain of financial data, with domain knowledge of Entity and Reference Data, including how it is built, maintained, and consumed in financial markets. Proven experience as a Data Product Owner or Product Manager working with large-scale datasets or data platforms. The ability to define a data product vision and communicate it clearly across technical and non-technical partners. Experience developing product roadmaps, managing backlogs, and leading cross-functional delivery in Agile or hybrid environments. A data-driven approach with comfort using metrics to assess product performance and guide prioritization. Strong collaboration and communication skills, with a track record of leading across Product, Engineering, and Data teams. Experience navigating ambiguity and delivering structure to complex, evolving domains. We'd love to see:Experience with data governance, quality frameworks, and metadata management. Understanding of third-party entity data providers and integration strategies. Experience with modern data infrastructure and architecture, including APIs, data pipelines, or LLM-based enrichment solutions. Awareness of emerging trends in Private Markets data and the growing complexity of non-public entity structures. Familiarity with financial workflows that rely on accurate entity data, such as client onboarding, compliance, KYC, counterparty risk, and issuer classification. Does this sound like you?Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are!                                                                                                                                                                                                                        10049209                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Description & Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                At Bloomberg Enterprise Data, we are fast-paced, innovative, and expanding! Our deep expertise in finance and financial technology (FinTech) allows us to partner closely with clients, understanding their unique business and data needs. With a vast selection of datasets covering all asset types, flexible delivery technologies, and tailored scheduling, we empower clients with the precise data they need - when and how they need it. Simply put, our award-winning data powers the capital markets. Our Data Management Services team (DMS) is an expanding part of Bloomberg's Enterprise Data group. DMS helps Bloomberg data together in a standardized model for easier and more consistent delivery across an organization's consuming systems. The DMS product - Data License Plus (DL+) -  is an add-on service for Bloomberg Data License that optimizes daily Bulk and Per Security file onboarding by combining the data into a centralized Unified Data Model (UDM) for controlled data collection and delivery across consuming systems. What's the role? We're looking for a dynamic Product Analyst to join the Data Management Services (DMS) team. This is a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between business needs and product development. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background and a keen interest in understanding and shaping the future of our data management solutions. You will work closely with both clients and internal teams, gathering requirements, analyzing data, and contributing to the strategic direction of our product offerings. We'll trust you to: ●	Use your understanding of Bloomberg data to facilitate the onboarding of data content to the DL+  platform. ●	Manage the onboarding of Sustainable Finance datasets into the DL+ platform, including coordination with internal Bloomberg Sustainable Finance teams and third-party Sustainable Finance data providers. ●	Own and coordinate ongoing Sustainable Finance data changes, including change notifications, dataset enhancements, and deprecations. ●	Act as a key point of contact between Product, Engineering, Sustainable Finance content teams, and external vendors to ensure Sustainable Finance data changes are accurately reflected in the product. ●	Gain an understanding of the DMS data model (UDM) and consider how the onboarding of new content will impact the model and product. ●	Engage with Bloomberg Product owners on changes to existing content and specifications for new content sets. ●	Gather and analyze business requirements from clients and stakeholders. ●	Build clear and concise requirements analysis, specifications, and business process documentation. ●	Define product requirements and functional specifications through collaboration with multiple partners. ●	Work with internal and external teams during client onboarding processes to ensure timely and quality deliverables.. ●	Deliver new product information and product updates to stakeholders (e.g., sales, marketing, engineering, support teams, and clients). ●	Provide support and direction to internal teams in the definition of technical solutions across the product suite. ●	Understand the product platform and its components and use it to improve client workflows. ●	Develop best practices for existing business patterns and new feature ideas. ●	Influence the strategic direction of the product by providing data-driven insights. ●	Share and build knowledge within the product team. You'll need to have: ●	Multiple years' experience in finance or the FinTech industry, particularly experience related to reference and pricing data. ●	Experience working with Sustainable Finance, sustainability, or non-financial datasets, including data sourced from third-party vendors. ●	Knowledge of asset classes like equities, fixed income, derivatives, indices, mortgages and their typical attributes and lifecycles, data used in the securities industry (especially related to reference data), pricing, FX, entity data, research data and OTCs. ●	Technical knowledge including but not limited to use of SQL, Python, and Cloud technologies. ●	Experience working in an agile environment. ●	Excellent communication skills, the ability to balance multiple projects and priorities with appropriate judgment and time management skills. ●	Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data. We'd love to see: ●	Knowledge of securities and trading lifecycle, typical front/middle/back office functions. ●	Data modeling experience in the financial services industry. ●	Familiarity with vendor-provided Sustainable Finance data and common Sustainable Finance data challenges (e.g., methodology changes, coverage gaps, revisions, and restatements). ●	An interest in meeting clients and prospects, learning about the industry and the challenges of implementing DL+, helping our global sales force. ●	Demonstrable analytical skills. ●	Thought leadership, passion and excitement for the product space. *Please note we use years of experience as a guide but we certainly will consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary for the role.
